h2.span: FAQs for Parents on Student Coping

p.span:
Click on this Link for:
FAQ's for Parents on Student Coping

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-size: 16px; text-align: left;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; font-size: 24px; color: rgb(79, 129, 189);

p.span: In an effort to reach out to parents who have concerns about their children’s emotional coping while at home, we are providing a FAQ forum. This forum will help guide you to some of the people and places where you can get more information and/or help for your child.

h3.style: font-size: 24px; font-family: latobold; font-weight: normal; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); text-align: center;

span.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: 16px; line-height: 17.12px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

p.span: Wythe County Public Schools would like to provide families a weekly update each Friday during the COVID-19 crisis. We remain committed to providing support to our families throughout this pandemic State of Emergency. A document of Frequently Asked Questions is located below to help provide transparency and information to our parents. This is still a very fluid situation and many things are evolving on a daily basis. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we all navigate through this unprecedented time.

span.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); line-height: 17.12px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;

span.span: Students, parents, and guardians may email teachers, counselors, and administration for any educational assistance during the extended state-wide school closing. If you have not been able to gain access to any of our online At-home Learning Activities, please contact your child’s school principal to let them know. We really appreciate all of our teachers and administrators for the efforts they continue to initiate to provide continuity of learning opportunities for our students during this difficult time. We are also very grateful to our families for investing a portion of your day to keep students' minds sharp while we are required to close our schools. Thank You, Stay Healthy, and Take Care!

span.br: Click here to read the message from Dr. S. Jefferies
